IX.iii.2.A.2.a
.
Definition:  Medicaid Plan
A
Medicaid plan
is a State plan for medical assistance per Title XIX, section 1902(a), of the Social Security Act (
42 U.S.C. 1396a(a)
).
Medicaid is available only to certain low-income individuals and families.  Medicaid does not pay money to individuals; instead, it sends payments directly to health care providers.
title: M21-1, Part IX, Subpart iii, Chapter 2, Section A - Pension Reductions for Medicaid-Covered Nursing Facility Care
citation: Part IX, Subpart iii, Chapter 2, Section A
